Identify and Annotate Shared Top Features Across Integration Factors

run_factor_overlap.Rd

Identifies top features that are shared (overlapping) across all integration factors (e.g., MOFA or MCIA), and optionally annotates whether these features are also robustly associated with the outcome (e.g., DEGs or stability-selected).

Usage

run_factor_overlap(
  expomicset,
  robust_comparison = TRUE,
  stability_score = NULL,
  score_col = "stability_score",
  pval_thresh = 0.05,
  logfc_thresh = log2(1.5),
  pval_col = "padj",
  logfc_col = "logFC",
  action = "add"
)

Arguments

expomicset

A MultiAssayExperiment containing top_factor_features in its metadata (usually generated by extract_top_factor_features()).

robust_comparison

Logical; if TRUE, uses sensitivity analysis (if available) to define robust associations. If FALSE, uses traditional DEG filters. Default is TRUE.

stability_score

Optional numeric threshold for robust filtering. If NULL, uses the score_thresh stored in metadata(expomicset)$sensitivity_analysis.

score_col

Character string specifying which score column to use from sensitivity analysis. Default is "stability_score".

pval_thresh

P-value threshold for differential abundance filtering. Used if robust_comparison = FALSE. Default is 0.05.

logfc_thresh

Log fold change threshold for differential abundance filtering. Used if robust_comparison = FALSE. Default is log2(1.5).

pval_col

Character string specifying the column in the differential abundance table containing p-values. Default is "padj".

logfc_col

Character string specifying the column in the differential abundance table containing log fold changes. Default is "logFC".

action

What to do with the results:

"add"

Store shared top features in metadata(expomicset)$common_top_factor_features and return the updated object.

"get"

Return the data frame of shared top features across all factors, including an is_deg column indicating outcome association.

Value

Either a modified MultiAssayExperiment object (if action = "add"), or a data.frame of overlapping top features (if action = "get").
